com.ad4screen.sdk

Class A4S

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ad4screen.sdk.A4S

  • public abstract class A4S
extends java.lang.Object
    Root class presenting Ad4Screen SDK functionalities.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  A4S.Callback<T>
      Callback used to return an operation result asynchronously
      static interface  A4S.MessageCallback
      Callback used to return an Inbox Message asynchronously

      • trackEvent

        public abstract void trackEvent(long eventId,
              java.lang.String... eventArgs)
        Sends an event with its accompanying information to Ad4Screen servers.
        Parameters:
        eventId - Identifier for the event type. Use any number between 1000 and 5000 by convention.
        eventArgs - Zero or more string parameters accompanying the event, used to back up business data on the server.

      • trackPurchase

        public abstract void trackPurchase(Purchase purchase)
        Send a purchase with or without items to Ad4Screen Servers
        Parameters:
        purchase - Purchase Object to send

      • trackAddToCart

        public abstract void trackAddToCart(Cart cart)
        Send an item to add to a given cart to Ad4screen Servers
        Parameters:
        cart - Cart Object to send

      • trackLead

        public abstract void trackLead(Lead lead)
        Send a lead to Ad4Screen Servers
        Parameters:
        lead - Lead Object to send

      • updateMessages

        public abstract void updateMessages(Inbox inbox)
        Send an update of read/unread status and archive status for this inbox to Ad4screen Servers
        Parameters:
        membersId - Array of members ID
        inbox - inbox to update

      • getInbox

        public abstract void getInbox(java.lang.String[] membersId,
            A4S.Callback<Inbox> callback)
        Retrieve all messages that belong to users
        Parameters:
        membersId - Users to retrieve messages
        callback - Return the Inbox with all the messages of these users

      • logIn

        public abstract void logIn(java.lang.String memberId)
        Log a member in order to display personalized content This method automatically link this user to this device. A user logged on multiple devices will receive same content (Push, In-App, Inbox...) Don't forget to LogOut If you want to unregister a user from this device (unlink device and user), please use removeMembers
        Parameters:
        memberId - user to log in
        See Also:
        logOut(), removeMembers(String[])

      • logOut

        public abstract void logOut()
        Log out a user on this device. Once the user is disconnected, content displayed on this device will not be personalized for this user Please note that the user is linked to this Device, so he will continue to receive personalized Push notifications If you want to unregister a user from this device (unlink device and user), please use removeMembers
        See Also:
        removeMembers(String[])

      • getActiveMember

        public abstract void getActiveMember(A4S.Callback<java.lang.String> callback)
        Return the current user logged or null if nobody is logged in at this time.
        Parameters:
        callback - current memberId or empty

      • getMembers

        public abstract void getMembers(A4S.Callback<java.lang.String[]> callback)
        Return all members linked to this device
        Parameters:
        callback - Array of membersId linked to this device

      • removeMembers

        public abstract void removeMembers(java.lang.String[] membersId)
        Unlink user and device. Users removed from the device will not receive personalized contents anymore. If one of the users you are removing is currently logged in, he will be automatically logged out.
        Parameters:
        membersId - users to permanently remove from this device

      • isGCMEnabled

        public abstract void isGCMEnabled(A4S.Callback<java.lang.Boolean> callback)
        Returns whether SDK is allowed to use GCM to notify the user with push notifications
        Note This function may return true even if user is not registered due to GCM restriction. This function only tells you that SDK is allowed to try to register user.
        Parameters:
        callback - Returns true trough callback if GCM use is allowed, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setGCMEnabled

      • setGCMEnabled

        public abstract void setGCMEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables GCM Push notifications for this device. Note even when enabled, the push may not work on the device due to GCM restrictions (Android version, Play store presence with Google Account connected, connectivity, ...)
        Warning User will not be able to receive push notification while disabled. Use with care!
        Parameters:
        enabled - True to enable push and try to register to GCM. False to unregister from GCM.
        See Also:
        isGCMEnabled

      • isRestrictedConnection

        public abstract void isRestrictedConnection(A4S.Callback<java.lang.Boolean> callback)
        Returns whether SDK is allowed to use the internet connection
        Parameters:
        callback - Returns true trough callback if Internet Connextion use is not restricted, false otherwise.

      • setRestrictedConnection

        public abstract void setRestrictedConnection(boolean restricted)
        Allows or disallows SDK to use Internet Connection. You can use it in order to temporarily disable request dispatch from SDK This can be useful if you need to do some important requests in your app and you don't want the SDK to use the bandwidth for a short amount of time Please don't forget to setRestrictedConnection(false) or the user will never be tracked again for this session
        Parameters:
        restricted, - if true SDK will stop dispatching request to Ad4Push servers

      • setInAppDisplayLocked

        public abstract void setInAppDisplayLocked(boolean locked)
        Allows you to allow or prevent InApp visual elements to be displayed. Default is false (display is enabled).
        Warning Once Inapp is locked, no InApp visual element will be displayed anymore until unlocked, use with care!
        Parameters:
        locked - True if you want to prevent any inapp display to be displayed anymore, false to unlock and allow display again.
        See Also:
        getInAppDisplayLocked

      • isInAppDisplayLocked

        public abstract void isInAppDisplayLocked(A4S.Callback<java.lang.Boolean> callback)
        Returns whether InApp display is allowed or not trough a callback. Note This function is asynchronous.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to return the result trough.
        See Also:
        setInAppDisplayLocked

      • setPushNotificationLocked

        public abstract void setPushNotificationLocked(boolean locked)
        Allows you to allow or prevent Landing Page of Push Notifications to be displayed. Default is false : Landing Pages of Rich Push will be displayed as soon as the app opens. For instance : You can lock push on your splashscreen and unlock it as soon as your main activity is displayed This will allow you to launch the clicked push only after your app is fully loaded
        Warning Once Push is locked, no Landing Page will be displayed anymore until unlocked, use with care! The last clicked push will be launched as soon as you unlock push notifications.
        Parameters:
        locked -

      • isPushNotificationLocked

        public abstract boolean isPushNotificationLocked()
        Returns whether RichPush display is allowed or not.
        See Also:
        setPushNotificationLocked

      • updateUserPreferences

        @Deprecated
public abstract void updateUserPreferences(android.os.Bundle bundle)
        Deprecated. 
        This method is deprecated, please use updateDeviceInfo
        Send user data to Ad4Push servers to update this device user information.
        Warning Only use this function if you have a segmentation plan. Ask your Ad4Screen contact for more information about segmentation and data formating
        Note The keys and values must match Ad4Push user information fields names and value to allow information to be correctly updated.
        Parameters:
        bundle - Bag of key/values pairs to be sent to Ad4Push to allow user segmentation.

      • updateDeviceInfo

        public abstract void updateDeviceInfo(android.os.Bundle bundle)
        Send user data to Ad4Push servers to update this device information.

        This method updates device information. Please care of sending only information that belongs to the device
        If you want to send some information about a member, please use updateMemberInfo

        Warning Only use this function if you have a segmentation plan. Ask your Ad4Screen contact for more information about segmentation and data formating
        Note The keys and values must match Ad4Push user information fields names and value to allow information to be correctly updated.
        Parameters:
        bundle - Bag of key/values pairs to be sent to Ad4Push to allow user segmentation.

      • updateMemberInfo

        public abstract void updateMemberInfo(android.os.Bundle bundle)
        Send member data to Ad4Push servers to update this member information.

        This method updates member information. Please care of sending only information that belongs to the current logged member
        If you want to send some information about this device, please use updateDeviceInfo

        Warning Only use this function if you have a segmentation plan. Ask your Ad4Screen contact for more information about segmentation and data formating
        Note The keys and values must match Ad4Push user information fields names and value to allow information to be correctly updated.
        Parameters:
        bundle - Bag of key/values pairs to be sent to Ad4Push to allow user segmentation.

      • updateGeolocation

        public abstract void updateGeolocation(android.location.Location location)
        Send a new Geolocation to Ad4Push Servers Use this method if you are using no-geoloc meta-data and you need to manually update geolocation of this device Please note that you can send a new Geolocation only once by 5 minutes
        Parameters:
        location -

      • getA4SId

        public abstract void getA4SId(A4S.Callback<java.lang.String> callback)
        Returns Ad4Screen user ID trough a callback if user was assigned an ID or null otherwise. Note this function is asynchronous. Warning The ID may be null until user was tracked once by the server.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to return user ID trough

      • getIDFV

        public abstract void getIDFV(A4S.Callback<java.lang.String> callback)
        Returns A4S generated IDFV. Note this function is asynchronous.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to return the IDFV through

      • getAndroidId

        public abstract java.lang.String getAndroidId()
        Returns Android (Secure) Id trough a callback if any or empty string otherwise. Note this function is asynchronous.
        Parameters:
        callback - The callback to return Android ID trough

      • putState

        public abstract void putState(java.lang.String name,
            java.lang.String value)
        Sets or remove a client-side state to a given value. Think of states like browser cookies which can be used to trigger Ad4Push inapp notifications.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the state to set or update
        value - The value for this state or null to remove the state.

      • setView

        public abstract void setView(java.lang.String viewName)
        Set the name of the view which is currently displayed to user You can use this to override a Tag annotation (when you are using FragmentActivity with multiple views for instance)
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the new view displayed

      • sendGCMToken

        public abstract void sendGCMToken(java.lang.String token)
        Send a GCM Token to Ad4Push Servers If you are retrieving GCM token by yourself, use this method to send obtained token to Ad4Push Servers As soon as a valid token has been sended, you will be able to Push from Ad4Push interface
        Parameters:
        token - GCM token returned from registration process

      • isInA4SProcess

        public static boolean isInA4SProcess(android.content.Context context)
        Call this function to determine if current process is dedicated to Ad4Screen service.
        Important You should not perform work in Ad4Screen dedicated process in most cases.
        Usage 
         if (A4S.isInA4SProcess(this)) {
        return;
 }
 // perform my work
        Parameters:
        context - Your application package context.
        Returns:
        true if current process is dedicated to Ad4Screen Service. False if current process is client application process.

      • setDoNotTrackEnabled

        public static void setDoNotTrackEnabled(android.content.Context context,
                        boolean enabled)
        Enables or disables DoNotTrack for Ad4Screen SDK.
        As most features cannot work while tracking is disabled, using DoNotTrack will disable Ad4Screen SDK completely. The shutdown may take some time. After this every call to any Ad4Screen API will be void until DoNotTrack is disabled.
        Important Use with care! this will disable all SDK features.
        Parameters:
        context - Your application package context.
        enabled - True to enable DoNotTrack and disable Ad4Screen SDK features, false to using tracking again.
        See Also:
        isDoNotTrackEnabled

      • isDoNotTrackEnabled

        public static boolean isDoNotTrackEnabled(android.content.Context context)
        Allows you to retrieve the state of DoNoTrack and therefore SDK status.
        Parameters:
        context - Your application package context.
        Returns:
        True if DoNotTrack is enabled and therefore SDK is disabled or disabling, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setDoNotTrackEnabled

      • get

        public static A4S get(android.content.Context context)
        Retrieves Ad4Screen API singleton object.
        Parameters:
        context - Your application package context.
        Returns:
        The Ad4Screen API singleton object in this process.
